title: Drone footage from 2017 bald eagle nest survey

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all video footage from drone flights from a July 2017 bald eagle survey near Kenai NWR Headquarters.

This missions were disclosed in a log of unmanned aerial vehicle missions released via a previous FOIA request. The remote pilot in command is listed as Lindeman, Carlson. The RID is RID-17-961. In response to a prior public records request, the Fish and Wildlife Service said, "it appears that the requested drone flight was flown by the Bureau of Reclamation." https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/fws-drone-footage-from-2017-bald-eagle-nest-survey-148087/#file-1125857

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

title: Catastrophe Claims Data

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Catastrophe Claims Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Raw data collected through the Insurance Regulation Filing System (IRFS) as uploaded and submitted by insurance companies between 2000 and the date this request is submitted. 

2. The Catastrophe Claims Data for all hurricanes listed on the page (https://floir.com/tools-and-data/catastrophe-reporting) and source data files for the summary tables and maps in CSV or machine-readable format and at the county and zip code levels. 

The summary tables and maps are already public, so I believe the underlying data exists. 

See, for example, Hurricane Michael: https://www.floir.com/Office/HurricaneSeason/HurricaneMichaelClaimsData.aspx

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Alice Tianbo Zhang

title: CMS Investigative File

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CMS Investigative File
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The complete investigative case file related to the deficiencies documented at Holston Valley Medical Center, Kingsport, Tennessee, on March 10, 2020, the survey completion date for EventID: O07B11. The investigation stems from complaint #50499 following the death of an unnamed patient who was admitted Nov. 9, 2019 after a motor vehicle crash and later died at the hospital (Facility ID: TNP531133) on Nov. 11, 2019. Please use the attached CMS-2567 form to aid in the production of the complete investigative file. 

This file may include but is not limited to: emails, written notes, video and audio recordings, copies of documents reviewed, transcripts of interviews and 911 calls, and settlements.  

I’m requesting expedited processing due to a “compelling need” for the public, particularly the residents of northeast Tennessee, to know about this hospital’s quality.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samantha Liss

title: Jason Trunco Banned from Niles Park District Property

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Jason Trunco Banned from Niles Park District Property
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Recently the Journal & Topics published a piece on October 13, 2023, with the title: "'I’m Sorry For My Actions’: Niles Library Trustee Indefinitely Banned From Park District Property"* describing a pattern of problematic behavior of Jason Trunco who currently sits on the Niles-Maine District Library board as a trustee.

We are seeking all documents regarding warnings and bans against Jason Trunco from Niles Park District property including but not limited to:

- Emails to/from Niles Park District Director Tom Elenz
- Texts, voicemails, and communications to/from Jason Trunco
- Complaints filed against Jason Trunco

*<https://web.archive.org/web/20231015232704/https%3A%2F%2Fwww.journal-topics.com%2Farticles%2Fim-sorry-for-my-actions-niles-library-trustee-indefinitely-banned-from-park-district-property%2F>

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Niles Coalition

title: Response to Twitter account @DDOTDCDirector

communications.subject: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: Response to Twitter account @DDOTDCDirector
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the DC Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records pertaining to the Department's response to the Twitter (or "X") account at  @DDOTDCDirector, including (but not limited to):
1. Any communications with media, reporters, or journalists concerning the account;
2. Any communications with Twitter (or "X") concerning the account;
3. Any records pertaining to the Department's assertion that "This account has been reported and asked for removal" (see: https://twitter.com/DDOTDC/status/1713320634476884280)
4. Any letters or correspondence to or from the operator of the account; and
5. Any records pertaining to any effort to identify the operator of the account.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

PLEASE NOTE: The Nevada Revised Statues does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. The WCSO typically processes requests in the order of receipt.  The time it takes to respond to a request will vary depending on the complexity of the request and any backlog of requests already pending.  A simple request can be processed faster than one that is complex.  Simple requests are typically more targeted and seek fewer pages of records.  Complex requests typically seek a high volume of material or require additional steps to process.  Some requests are submitted for legal review for confidentiality and privilege, which increases the time for processing. Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. Washoe County Sheriff's Office

Your request is being processed in accordance with the Nevada Public Records Act (NPRA), Nevada Revised Statutes (NRS) Chapter 239, and the Nevada System of Higher Education (NSHE) Board of Regents Handbook and Policies. Pursuant to NRS 239.0107(1)(c) within five (5) business days from the day after receiving this request for public record, the UNLV Office of Public Affairs will provide records or notify the requester of of the following: one 
 
  * Provide readily available record(s) to the requester for inspection or copying 
  * Give notice that the University is not the custodian of the record(s) and, if known, refer the requester to the appropriate state agency to request the record(s) 
  * Give notice that the record(s) will not be available within the five-day period and provide an estimated date when the record will be available for release. 
  * Provide notice that the request for release is denied, in part or in whole, and state the legal basis for its decision. If we release records, you can download them for a limited period of 60 days. 
 PLEASE NOTE: Nevada Administrative Code (NAC 239.867) provides no requirement for state agencies to create a public record that does not exist. Requests for information, legal research, or answers to general questions are not subject to the Nevada Public Records Act and will be handled accordingly. 
 Regularly monitor the progress of your request in My Request Center  
 
Sincerely, 
 
Office of Public Affairs 
University of Nevada, Las Vegas

  * Give notice that the record(s) will not be available within the five-day period and provide an estimated date when the record will be available for release. 
  * Provide notice that the request for release is denied, in part or in whole, and state the legal basis for its decision. If we release records, you can download them for a limited period of 60 days. 
 PLEASE NOTE: Nevada Administrative Code (NAC 239.867) provides no requirement for state agencies to create a public record that does not exist. Requests for information, legal research, or answers to general questions are not subject to the Nevada Public Records Act and will be handled accordingly. 
 Regularly monitor the progress of your request in My Request Center  
 
Sincerely, 
 
Office of Public Affairs 
University of Nevada, Las Vegas

title: Captain Sentry

communications.communication:
Dear Tinker Air Force Base:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED:

I am seeking records related to "Captain Sentry," the mascot of the 552nd Air Control Wing.

Specifically, I request the following records:

1. Please produce all records related to the conception, creation, and design of Captain Sentry. Please include any contracts or design concepts (e.g. sketches) in your production, as well as any records related to the Air Force's decision to create the mascot in the first place.

2. Please produce all Captain Sentry-related promotional items, educational items, or tchotchkes that take the form of records, such as trading cards, posters, photographs, videos, or books (including but not limited to coloring books, activity books, or comic books).

3. Please produce all records related to the conception, creation, design, and use of any wearable Captain Sentry Sentry costumes, such as the one depicted in the attached photo and at the following links: 
https://www.507arw.afrc.af.mil/News/Photos/igphoto/2003245926/ 
https://www.facebook.com/552acw/posts/363945359110596/. 
Responsive records would include contracts for the design or production of such a costume; design proposals or sketches; correspondence with the designer or manufacturer; and any guidelines related to the use of or care for the costume.

4. Please produce all communications related to Captain Sentry.

5. Please produce all correspondence related to Captain Sentry (or to mascots in general) sent to or from any Congressional member, office, committee, or staff. U.S. Senator Joni Ernst (R-IA) may have sent some responsive correspondence around 2019.

6. Please produce all records related to any proposal or decision to stop using the Captain Sentry mascot.

REQUEST FOR FEE WAIVER:

The requested documents will be made available to the general public online for free, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am working on a project examining the history, creation, evolution, and use of mascots across the federal government—because, like many others, I find them fascinating and weirdly delightful. Thus, I respectfully request that any fees related to this request be waived. If you do decide to charge me fees, please notify me in advance if you expect those fees to exceed $25.

FORM OF PRODUCTION:

I would prefer that this request be filled electronically, by email attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION:

Thank you very much for your cooperation with this request. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz
